result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernard Gregory Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $500.00, all costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid by 6/10/15.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Provide DNA sample unless previously submitted, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernard Gregory Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing. Statements made as to sentencing. 

As to COUNT1-
-Court ordered the defendant to pay a $500.00 fine to be paid by 6/10/2015. Court will allow defendant to enroll in a payment plan. 
-Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 6/10/15. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay DNA surcharge.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Bernard Gregory in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. 
Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 1-
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Bernard Gregory in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Branch 25 in trial and unable to hear this matter. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter and request a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Case recalled at the end of the morning. Neither party present, defendant not present. Defendant appeared in court after the case was called this morning. Court ordered the bench warrant previously stayed to be withdrawn. Case remains scheduled for scheduling conference on 12/08/14. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Hazel Jean Washington in court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defendant not in court. Discussion regarding Justice Point reports. Parties make joint request to issue but stay a bench warrant. Court grants joint request and ordered a bench warrant be issued but STAYED until the next court date. Defense counsel will attempt to contact the defendant and advise him of the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Violation report - missed telephone contact - received and filed. Court will address the violation on the next court date. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Bernard Gregory in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery yet and requests an adjourned scheduling date. State does not object. Court grants request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Bernard Gregory in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Hanna Kolberg for Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
    Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report, dated 11-05-2014.

14RM049063  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
10-24-2014
Preliminary hearing on November 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bernard Gregory in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Bernard Gregory in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
